page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Employment in the early days was very localised with few people travelling out of the village itself.This is basically an agricultural area and most of the employment was concentrated in that industry.There has always been a smithy once shoeing horses,now making farm machinery. R.A.F.Cranwell,only five miles away attracted employment and a number of workmen used to cycle there each day. As more people have their own transport,servicemen and civilians live in the Village and travel to Cranwell daily.Many people now also travel into the towns of Grantham and Lincoln each about 12 miles away.The Lincs.Road Car Service links Grantham and Lincoln and passes through Leadenham enabling people from the Village to travel to the towns for employment in the shops and factories.
